(Simplified: 跷)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 堯 indicates the sound; 足 (foot) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 足 [ zú ] foot; to attain, to satisfy; enough
    • 堯 [ yáo ] a legendary ancient emperor-sage
①腳向上擡：蹺腳。蹺腿。
②(蹺蹊)奇怪，違反常理讓人懷疑。亦稱“蹊蹺”。
③豎起大拇指：蹺着大拇指。
蹺蹺板 [ qiāo qiāo bǎn ]: see-saw

蹺字的基本解释

蹺
qiāo
见“跷”。

蹺字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qiāo］
［《廣韻》去遥切，平宵，溪。］
亦作“蹻1”。“跷1”的繁体字。
(1)举足；抬腿。
(2)迈步；跨步。
(3)踮起脚后跟。
(4)跛。
(5)指脚。
(6)传统戏剧、舞蹈中供表演者绑在脚上使用的一种木制道具。高者三四尺，低者尺馀。
(7)指举足高飞。相传为道教所传飞行之术。
(8)扣除。
(9)用同“翹”。向上昂起。
(10)不踏实。参见“蹺然”。
(11)指死。
(12)用同“橇”。参见“蹺車”。
(13)见“蹺怪”、“蹺蹊”。
(14)中医名词。指捷举手足。
(15)中医名词。指跷脉。中医奇经八脉名。包括阳跷，阴跷。参见“蹺脈”。

蹺字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【足字部】　蹺； 康熙笔画：19； 页码：页1234第06
【廣韻】去堯切【集韻】【韻會】丘祅切，?音趫。【玉篇】舉足也。或作蹻。　又【集韻】牽幺切，音鄡。義同。

蹺字的源字形

蹺字的起名意思

暂无。

Stilt
Basic explanation of words
Stilt
qiāo
See "stilt".
Stilt
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qiāo］
["Guangyun" goes to remote cutting, flat night, creek. ]
Also known as "蹻1". Traditional characters for "Saw 1".
(1) Lift the foot; raise the leg.
(2) Take a step; take a step.
(3) Stand on your heels.
(4) Lameness.
(5) Fingers.
(6) A wooden prop used by performers tied to their feet in traditional dramas and dances. The tall one is three or four feet, and the low one is more than one.
(7) Refers to flying high. According to legend, it is the art of flying taught by Taoism.
(8) Deduction.
(9) Use the same as "Alice". Lift up.
(10) Not practical. See also "Qiao Ran".
(11) Refers to death.
(12) Use the same "skid". See "walking car".
(13) See "Odds" and "Odds".
(14) Chinese medical terms. Pointing at the hands and feet.
(15) Chinese medical terms. Refers to the cross pulse. Names of the Eight Meridians of the Odd Meridian in Chinese Medicine. Including Yang Qiao, Yin Qiao. See "cross pulse".
Stilt
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Unitary Collection] [Foot Character Department] 　qiao; Kangxi Strokes: 19; Page Number: Page 1234 Page 06
[Guangyun] Go to Yaoqie [Jiyun] [Yunhui] Qiu Zuoqie,? [Jade articles] Lift your feet. Or make a mistake.　[Jiyun] Linking one another, sounding. The same meaning.
